intro: Vittadinia australasica var. subglabra, commonly known as the smooth vittadinia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as grasslands and heathlands. It is a perennial species that produces numerous small seeds, which are dispersed by wind. The variety subglabra is distinguished by its smooth, hairless stem and leaves, setting it apart from other varieties of the species.
